title: New Associate Doctor Underperforms
summary: Associate production is significantly below expectation. Develop without discouraging; choose structured mentorship or clear targets with support.

scene.setting: Associate production is significantly below expectation. Financial pressure increases; the owner feels disappointment. The hidden risk is confidence damage. The decision point is terminate or coach.

beats.narration: The gap is clear. The decision point is strict deadline or structured mentorship.

dialogue.speaker: owner
dialogue.line: I want to set clear goals and give you the support to get there. Can we start with a weekly check-in and one priority?

choices.label: Set a strict production target and deadline; terminate if not met.

steps.step: Add clear targets plus weekly check-ins; identify barriers before deadline.
Document exit plan if no progress; communicate clearly.

leader_lines: Targets are clear. So is supportâ€”weekly check-ins and barriers we can fix.
questions: What would need to change to hit the target?
scripts.closing_line: Accountability and support; one exit plan if no progress.

choices.label: Start a structured mentorship: goals, feedback, and resources.

steps.step: Weekly 1:1; production and clinical goals; timeline and milestones.
Document one mentorship element (case review, goals, or resources).

leader_lines: Let's build a clear path: goals, feedback, and one thing I can do to support.
questions: What would a mentorship program include?

choices.label: Give more time and hope they improve on their own.

steps.step: Set written goals and one regular performance conversation.

leader_lines: Hope isn't a strategy. Let's make expectations explicit and meet regularly.
questions: How often do we talk performance?
scripts.closing_line: Written goals; regular conversation; support or PIP if needed.

choices.label: Reduce their schedule and take over some production yourself.

steps.step: Set a date for handback; pair with coaching and clear success criteria.

leader_lines: I'll cover for now, but we need a handback date and clear success criteria.
questions: When do we transition from absorb to develop?
What would success look like when you take it back?

system_prompts.nudge: Structured mentorship builds capability and loyalty.

outcomes.message: The associate may feel unsupported. Pressure alone rarely develops people.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with structured mentorship?
How do you balance accountability with support?

outcomes.message: The associate has a clear path. Performance may improve; retention rises.
reflection_questions: Which element of mentorship helped most?
What would a full program include?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I developed someone with clear goals and support. (1-5)
